PISTOL.strategy: **A Site Rush**: All 5 players buy armor. Rush A main together with coordinated pop-flashes. First two players trade frag, last three clean up site. Simple but effective with good timing.
**Mid Control**: 3 players go mid (1 with smoke), 2 players go A main. Mid players smoke connector, take middle control. A players create noise but don't commit unless mid gets pick.
**B Split**: 2 players go B main, 3 players go through mid to B. Mid players smoke connector, wait for B main contact, then execute split timing. One player buys HE grenade.
**A Default**: 2 A main, 2 mid, 1 B. Play for picks and information. Mid players smoke connector if they get aggressive. Rotate based on what we see - patience is key.
**Donut Rush**: 4 players A main, 1 player B (noise only). A players coordinate pop-flashes and rush donut/site together. B player makes noise then rotates through mid.
**Mid to B**: All 5 players go mid. Smoke connector, flash over smoke, rush through to B site. Fast execution - no hesitation once smokes are down.
**A Fake to B**: 3 players make noise A main with utility, 2 players go B main quietly. Once A players get response, they rotate through mid to help B.
**Temple Control**: 2 players A main, 3 players mid focusing on temple area. Temple players smoke connector, take temple control, then decide A or B based on rotations.
**Stack B**: 4 players B main with utility, 1 player A main for info. B players use pop-flashes and coordinate peek. A player rotates after getting information.
**Anti-Eco**: Spread utility across team (2 smokes, 2 flashes, 1 HE). Play default positions, use utility to isolate duels. Don't overpeek - let them come to us.

ECO.strategy: **Five-Seven A Rush**: Everyone buys Five-Seven + armor. Rush A main together with pop-flashes. Focus on trading kills and getting weapons. First two players go for aggressive peeks.
**Stack B**: All 5 players stack B site. Buy upgraded pistols + armor. Play close angles, use pop-flashes, focus on overwhelming one player at a time.
**Mid Lurk**: 1 player lurks mid with upgraded pistol, 4 players force buy A main. Mid player waits for rotation, then goes for late round picks.
**Deagle + Support**: 2 players buy Deagle + armor, 3 players support with flashes/smokes. Deagle players take long angles mid and A main. Support players trade frag.
**Temple Rush**: 4 players buy armor + upgraded pistols, rush temple from mid. 1 player saves in spawn. Temple players use pop-flashes and focus on close-range duels.
**Anti-Force**: 3 players buy armor + Five-Seven, 2 players save completely. Force players go A main, play for picks, then save weapons. Savers stay in spawn.
**B Main Contact**: 2 players buy armor + upgraded pistols B main, 3 players save mid. B players go for aggressive contact, mid players rotate if picks happen.
**Connector Fight**: 3 players buy armor + upgraded pistols, fight connector from mid. 2 players save A main. Connector players use pop-flashes, play for picks.
**Split Save**: 2 players force buy A main, 2 players force buy B main, 1 player saves mid. Both sides play for picks, saver rotates to help successful side.
**Full Save**: All players save money completely. Play for exit frags only. 2 players A main, 2 players B main, 1 player mid. Get information and positioning for next round.

HALF_BUY.strategy: **A Main Control**: 3 players buy rifles, 2 players buy SMGs. Rifles take A main control with smokes/flashes. SMGs support or rotate based on reads. Focus on map control.
**Mid Presence**: 2 rifles mid, 2 SMGs A main, 1 rifle B. Mid players smoke connector, take temple control. Create pressure from multiple angles.
**B Split Execute**: 2 rifles B main, 2 SMGs mid to B, 1 rifle A (lurk). Mid players smoke connector, execute split with B main. Lurker goes for late round pick.
**Economy Aggression**: 3 rifles, 2 SMGs. Rifles take key angles (A main, mid, B main), SMGs play support. Focus on getting picks to upgrade economy.
**Temple Control**: 4 players mid (2 rifles, 2 SMGs), 1 rifle A main. Mid players smoke connector, take temple. Decide A or B based on rotations.
**Anti-Full Buy**: 2 rifles long angles, 3 SMGs close angles. Rifles hold A main and mid connector, SMGs play site. Use utility to isolate duels.
**Donut Focus**: 3 rifles A main, 2 SMGs B main. A players smoke donut, take site control. B players make noise, rotate if needed.
**Connector Deny**: 2 rifles mid, 2 SMGs A main, 1 rifle B. Mid rifles smoke connector, deny middle control. Force them to go around.
**Pick Heavy**: Spread team across map with rifles on long angles. 1 rifle A main, 1 rifle mid, 1 rifle B, 2 SMGs floating. Play for picks.
**Site Focus**: 4 players A (2 rifles, 2 SMGs), 1 rifle B. A players smoke multiple angles, take site control. B player plays for information.

FULL_BUY.strategy: **A Site Execute**: Smoke donut + A main, flash over smokes. 4 players execute A site with proper utility usage. 1 player lurks mid for late round rotation.
**Mid Control**: 3 players mid with smokes/flashes, 2 players A main. Mid players smoke connector, take temple control, then decide A or B execute.
**B Split**: 2 players B main, 3 players mid to B. Smoke connector + B site, flash over smokes. Execute split with perfect timing.
**Default Setup**: 2 A main, 2 mid, 1 B. Smoke key angles, play for picks. AWPer mid, riflers A main. Execute based on information gathered.
**A Fake to B**: 3 players make noise A main with utility, 2 players position mid. Once rotations happen, all 5 execute B through mid.
**Temple Take**: 4 players mid, 1 player A main. Mid players smoke connector, take temple control with flashes. Execute A or B based on reads.
**Anti-Stack B**: Smoke A main + donut, 4 players execute A site. 1 player mid watches for rotations. Heavy utility usage on A site.
**Connector Control**: 3 players mid, 2 players A main. Mid players smoke connector, fight for middle control. Strong utility usage to win mid.
**Late Round B**: Play default until 45 seconds, then all 5 execute B through mid. Use smokes + flashes for late round timing.
**AWP Setup**: AWPer mid, 2 riflers A main, 2 riflers B main. AWPer calls rotations, riflers execute based on AWP information. Utility supports AWPer.
